label: POPE700982
info_overview: The POPP Door/Window Sensor is a sensor, which detects, if your window is opened, closed or tilted. The sensor is easily retroﬁttable. Furthermore, the POPP Door/Window Sensor can include other sensors by being connected with other binary sensors like NTC contacts, micro switches or ﬂood sensor. Thanks to its slim design the POPP Door/Windows can be installed unﬂashy on every window. The sensor just has to be installed on the window casement. Additionally, there has to be a slim magnet installed closely to the sensor at the window frame. By using a patented method the sensor can reliably detect the exact position of the window. With the potential free input the Door/Window Sensor can also include other sensors in your Z-Wave system. For that the binary sensor is connected to the potential free input of the sensor. Besides sensors there can also be connected momentary switches, which controls scenes in your gateway.
info_usage: Once installed the sensor will report open and close status changes to a central Z-Wave controller using notiﬁcation commands. Addtionally the sensor can directly control other device using the association group 2. Using conﬁguration commands the source of open and close events can choosen between the internal magnet detector or external dry contact connected via the screw terminal. The device is protected by a tamper switch.

parameters.label: Sensor Operation Mode
parameters.description: Iinternal magnet sensor or the external terminal
parameters.overview: This parameter deﬁnes if the internal magnet sensor or the external terminal input is detected and used to issue alarm notiﬁcation. There is always one input active only. The other sensor input the deactivated. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: Sensor State Polarity
parameters.description: This parameter deﬁnes the polarity of the magnet sensor
parameters.overview: This parameter deﬁnes the polarity of the magnet sensor. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: Visual LED Indications
parameters.description: This parameter deﬁnes when the red LED will indicate events
parameters.overview: This parameter deﬁnes when the red LED will indicate events. Disabling all indications may extend battery life. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 7 (values 1 + 2 + 4 summarized)

parameters.label: Range Test after double click
parameters.description: Allows to enable the activation of a Z-Wave range test
parameters.overview: Allows to enable the activation of a Z-Wave range test with double clicking the tamper switch. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: 2nd Association Group Trigger
parameters.description: Status of the magnet switch that causes sending command
parameters.overview: This parameter deﬁnes the status of the magnet switch that causes sending a BASIC command to all devices of Association Group 2. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: Command Sent to Devices of Association Group 2
parameters.description: which commands is sent to 2nd Association Group
parameters.overview: This parameter deﬁnes which commands is sent to 2nd Association Group Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 2

parameters.label: Value sent to 2nd Association Group on On event
parameters.description: value sent in case of On event
parameters.overview: This is the BASIC command value sent in case of On event. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 255. Only 0 to 99 are valid values

parameters.label: value sent to 2nd Association Group on Off event
parameters.description: value sent in case of Off event
parameters.overview: This is the BASIC command value sent in case of Off event. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: Time Delay of On command frame
parameters.overview: On command is sent after a delay deﬁned in this parameter. Size: 2 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: Time Delay of Off command frame
parameters.overview: Off command is sent after a delay deﬁned in this parameter. Size: 2 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: Delay of Tamper Alarm Cancellation
parameters.description: Time a tamper alarm is delayed in seconds
parameters.overview: Time a tamper alarm is delayed. Size: 2 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: Reporting Tamper Alarm Cancellation
parameters.description: This parameter deﬁnes if the alarm cancellation event is reported
parameters.overview: This parameter deﬁnes if the alarm cancellation event is reported. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 1

parameters.label: Central Scene Event Functionality
parameters.overview: This parameter enables/disables the central scene function. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 0

parameters.label: Tilt Sensor Functionality
parameters.overview: This parameter enables/disables the tilt function. Size: 1 Byte, Default Value: 1

associations.label: Control devices
associations.description: Control devices when magnet or external dry contacts trips

associations.label: send alarm message
associations.description: sends our alarm message when magnet controlled or external dry sensor trips

associations.label: send tamper alarm
associations.description: sends alarm messages when tamper is tripped

documents.label: Door and Window Sensor with Tilt Detection

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
